alert.note: Alert for Dubuque; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 6:23PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jackson and southeastern Dubuque Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 622 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Zwingle, or 11 miles south of Dubuque, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bellevue, La Motte, St. Donatus, Bernard, Zwingle, Swiss Valley Park, Cottonville, Otter Creek, South Gary Owen, Dubuque Regional Airport, Garry Owen, and Washington Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
